I hear a lot of people arguing about the fact that he worked really hard to earn this he did period without the effort he put in to his business and social media he would not be so successful and that is hard work however I will say and don't come off me really not trying to undermine all the hard work he did do but I will say that when it comes to influencers like this there is a certain amount of privilege a part of the reason any of them are that successful has to do with time and place they were lucky to be either living in LA already or had a family or their own money and were willing to move for their career I live in a very small town on and island in Canada there are zero opportunities here for people looking to build their careers through social media and I don't want that kind of life anyways it comes with many sacrifices and hardships I'm just speaking for the people who I know who are extremely talented and can do things at a very professional level example visual artists, makup artists, and even though they are just as good if not better than some of the people who are very well known for those things they will never live somwhere that has opportunities for them and they do not have the family or the money to move to LA considering most of the middle class who live here are still usually struggling which is also fucking ridiculous but a different conversation and obviously that affects people everywhere anyway just wanted to explain why some people think or say he has done no hard work when obviously he has but yes coming from the experience of somone who even if they wanted to walk the walk wouldn't really have that option I do understand the frustration of always hearing people say they worked from nothing because that is not true everyone has a start and where you live and how much money you had growing up can make way more of a difference than a lot of people are willing to admit

Ashley Eng: 20 years old // Houston, Texas Instagram, twitter, and tiktok handles: @ashley_engg  /// snapchat: @ashley_eng WHY: If I had the privileged to win $20,000, I would give it all to my momma. Everything she has done for me, all her sacrifices, this amount of money would never be nearly enough to repay her. All of my life, my mommy has sacrificed her happiness and her education to raise my siblings and I and put us through school. For 19-20 years, the majority of my life, my family has lived in a hoarder house... and it is no exaggeration. Behind closed doors, years of arguing and emotional scarring has taken a heavy tool on my mom, my siblings, and I. On the outside, I may seem like a normal student with a normal life, but behind closed doors, you will never see the real life that someone lives. Each year I ask my mom to let us leave.. to finally allow her to be happy and to live the life she has always dreamed of, but every year she tells me "we will the next year when I earn enough money". But every year we stay, because there are endless bills of thousand dollars of debt and bills to pay and expenses. She chooses to stay in a house with someone that has caused her years of torment, for her family and in order to help her kids and her parents and her other family members. My mom has always be this kindhearted angel that took care of her uncle and her parents and every single person in the family, no matter if she had the money or not, and no matter if her own life situation was hard. She never let anyone know, but I have seen her breakdown and cry in my arms about being so sad and unhappy and tired of everything.. My siblings and I work hard everyday to try to alleviate the weight on my mom's shoulders. My momma has told me that after I graduate, that is when she will try to leave, because she won't have enough money to support me on my own now... Even now, my mom struggles to get me through school and has to ask my siblings for favors. Every chance I get, I try to take part-time jobs or random jobs to try to not be a burden on my mom, but it's hard to know that she is staying in this situation for a couple more years, because of me.. First it was going to be "when I graduated high school", then it's "when I graduate college", but every moment that my mom suffers in silence, makes me feel like a burden. I know that this money isn't that much, in perspective of helping clear my mom's debt and her responsibilities, but it would be such a blessing if I could give her this to help her even a little to try and start anew. I don't even need this money for myself, because I do not mind working hard for my own earnings and trying to give my earnings to my mom. I choose a career that is driven by passion and love (and not money), and my mom has always been supportive of that.. but sometimes I think I am being selfish and I want to quit in order to take care of my mom like she has taken care of me. But my mom encourages me to follow my dreams, despite what she has to sacrifice and her sufferings.. and I just wish I could be more than just a burden.   But even if I wasn't chosen, that is okay too. I will continue to work hard and make my momma proud. Thank you for taking the time to read this. And I hope you and everyone are staying safe and healthy. Thank you James for being an inspiration to many and it is always a pleasure to watch your videos. <3
Ashley Eng: 20 years old // Houston, Texas Instagram, twitter, and tiktok handles: @ashley_engg  /// snapchat: @ashley_eng - If I had the privileged to win $20,000, I would give it all to my momma. Everything she has done for me, all her sacrifices, this amount of money would never be nearly enough to repay her. All of my life, my mommy has sacrificed her happiness and her education to raise my siblings and I and put us through school. Behind closed doors, years of arguing and emotional scarring has taken a heavy tool on my mom, my siblings, and I. On the outside, I may seem like a normal student with a normal life, but behind closed doors, you will never see the real life that someone lives. Each year I ask my mom to let us leave.. to finally allow her to be happy and to live the life she has always dreamed of, but every year she tells me "we will the next year when I earn enough money". But every year we stay, because there are endless bills of thousand dollars of debt and bills to pay and expenses. She chooses to stay in a house with someone that has caused her years of torment, for her family and in order to help her kids and her parents and her other family members. My mom has always be this kindhearted angel that took care of her uncle and her parents and every single person in the family, no matter if she had the money or not, and no matter if her own life situation was hard. She never let anyone know, but I have seen her breakdown and cry in my arms about being so sad and unhappy and tired of everything.. My siblings and I work hard everyday to try to alleviate the weight on my mom's shoulders. My momma has told me that after I graduate, that is when she will try to leave, because she won't have enough money to support me on my own now... Even now, my mom struggles to get me through school and has to ask my siblings for favors. Every chance I get, I try to take part-time jobs or random jobs to try to not be a burden on my mom, but it's hard to know that she is staying in this situation for a couple more years, because of me.. First it was going to be "when I graduated high school", then it's "when I graduate college", but every moment that my mom suffers in silence, makes me feel like a burden. I know that this money isn't that much, in perspective of helping clear my mom's debt and her responsibilities, but it would be such a blessing if I could give her this to help her even a little to try and start anew. I don't even need this money for myself, because I do not mind working hard for my own earnings and trying to give my earnings to my mom. I choose a career that is driven by passion and love (and not money), and my mom has always been supportive of that.. but sometimes I think I am being selfish and I want to quit in order to take care of my mom like she has taken care of me. But my mom encourages me to follow my dreams, despite what she has to sacrifice and her sufferings.. and I just wish I could be more than just a burden.   But even if I wasn't chosen, that is okay too. I will continue to work hard and make my momma proud. Thank you for taking the time to read this. And I hope you and everyone are staying safe and healthy. Thank you James for being an inspiration to many and it is always a pleasure to watch your videos. <3
Kaylee white New York, United States  Insta: k_white7

Ashley Eng I am 20 years old and I am from Houston, Texas Instagram, twitter, and tiktok handles: @ashley_engg  /// snapchat: ashley_eng - If I had the privileged to win $20,000, I would give it all to my momma. Everything she has done for me, all her sacrifices, this amount of money would never be nearly enough to repay her. All of my life, my mommy has sacrificed her happiness and her education to raise my siblings and I and put us through school. For 19-20 years, the majority of my life, my family has lived in a hoarder house... and it is no exaggeration. Behind closed doors, years of arguing and emotional scarring has taken a heavy tool on my mom, my siblings, and I. On the outside, I may seem like a normal student with a normal life, but behind closed doors, you will never see the real life that someone lives. Each year I ask my mom to let us leave.. to finally allow her to be happy and to live the life she has always dreamed of, but every year she tells me "we will the next year when I earn enough money". But every year we stay, because there are endless bills of thousand dollars of debt and bills to pay and expenses. She chooses to stay in a house with someone that has caused her years of torment, for her family and in order to help her kids and her parents and her other family members. My mom has always be this kindhearted angel that took care of her uncle and her parents and every single person in the family, no matter if she had the money or not, and no matter if her own life situation was hard. She never let anyone know, but I have seen her breakdown and cry in my arms about being so sad and unhappy and tired of everything.. My siblings and I work hard everyday to try to alleviate the weight on my mom's shoulders. My momma has told me that after I graduate, that is when she will try to leave, because she won't have enough money to support me on my own now... Even now, my mom struggles to get me through school and has to ask my siblings for favors. Every chance I get, I try to take part-time jobs or random jobs to try to not be a burden on my mom, but it's hard to know that she is staying in this situation for a couple more years, because of me.. First it was going to be "when I graduated high school", then it's "when I graduate college", but every moment that my mom suffers in silence, makes me feel like a burden. I know that this money isn't that much, in perspective of helping clear my mom's debt and her responsibilities, but it would be such a blessing if I could give her this to help her even a little to try and start anew. I don't even need this money for myself, because I do not mind working hard for my own earnings and trying to give my earnings to my mom. I choose a career that is driven by passion and love (and not money), and my mom has always been supportive of that.. but sometimes I think I am being selfish and I want to quit in order to take care of my mom like she has taken care of me. But my mom encourages me to follow my dreams, despite what she has to sacrifice and her sufferings.. and I just wish I could be more than just a burden.   But even if I wasn't chosen, that is okay too. I will continue to work hard and make my momma proud. Thank you for taking the time to read this. And I hope you and everyone are staying safe and healthy. Thank you James for being an inspiration to many and it is always a pleasure to watch your videos. <3

Name: Ashley Eng Age: 20 years old  Location: Houston, Texas Instagram handle: ashley_engg If I had the privileged to win $20,000, I would give it all to my momma. Everything she has done for me, all her sacrifices, this amount of money would never be nearly enough to repay her. All of my life, my mommy has sacrificed her happiness and her education to raise my siblings and I and put us through school. For 19-20 years, the majority of my life, my family has lived in a hoarder house... and it is no exaggeration. Behind closed doors, years of arguing and emotional scarring has taken a heavy tool on my mom, my siblings, and I. On the outside, I may seem like a normal student with a normal life, but behind closed doors, you will never see the real life that someone lives. Each year I ask my mom to let us leave.. to finally allow her to be happy and to live the life she has always dreamed of, but every year she tells me "we will the next year when I earn enough money". But every year we stay, because there are endless bills of thousand dollars of debt and bills to pay and expenses. She chooses to stay in a house with someone that has caused her years of torment, for her family and in order to help her kids and her parents and her other family members. My mom has always be this kindhearted angel that took care of her uncle and her parents and every single person in the family, no matter if she had the money or not, and no matter if her own life situation was hard. She never let anyone know, but I have seen her breakdown and cry in my arms about being so sad and unhappy and tired of everything.. My siblings and I work hard everyday to try to alleviate the weight on my mom's shoulders. My momma has told me that after I graduate, that is when she will try to leave, because she won't have enough money to support me on my own now... Even now, my mom struggles to get me through school and has to ask my siblings for favors. Every chance I get, I try to take part-time jobs or random jobs to try to not be a burden on my mom, but it's hard to know that she is staying in this situation for a couple more years, because of me.. First it was going to be "when I graduated high school", then it's "when I graduate college", but every moment that my mom suffers in silence, makes me feel like a burden. I know that this money isn't that much, in perspective of helping clear my mom's debt and her responsibilities, but it would be such a blessing if I could give her this to help her even a little to try and start anew. I don't even need this money for myself, because I do not mind working hard for my own earnings and trying to give my earnings to my mom. I choose a career that is driven by passion and love (and not money), and my mom has always been supportive of that.. but sometimes I think I am being selfish and I want to quit in order to take care of my mom like she has taken care of me. But my mom encourages me to follow my dreams, despite what she has to sacrifice and her sufferings.. and I just wish I could be more than just a burden.  But even if I wasn't chosen, that is okay too. I will continue to work hard and make my momma proud. Thank you for taking the time to read this. And I hope you and everyone are staying safe and healthy. Thank you James for being an inspiration to many and it is always a pleasure to watch your videos. <3

Jeannie Lozowski 22 Philadelphia, PA instagram: @justjeanniemarie Hi James! My name is Jeannie and I am a current nursing masters student at the University of Pennsylvania. I grew up playing tennis competitively and was even able to compete as a Division One athlete until I sustained a serious wrist injury, which unfortunately ended my career. Giving up a sport that meant so much to me was heartbreaking, but it made me focus more on my passion of helping and serving others. I was able to work with the nonprofit organizations: "Love Serving Autism" and "Aceing Autism" which teaches and connects individuals with autism through tennis programs. The game of tennis has made such a positive influence on their lives by providing them an outlet to be active, form friendships, and even have fun. These organizations have been such a big influence on my life as well as it shaped my passion to serve individuals with autism and led me to pursue nursing as a career. I am currently at the nations #1 Ivy League Nursing school in the country which will help me to become one of the nations top Nurse Practitioners specialized in advancing care for individuals with autism. If I were to win the $20,000, I would pay off some of my loans from attending school as well as open up my own clinic and non-profit that treats autistic individuals. It is my ultimate goal to advance research behind autism and combine my passion of tennis and healthcare to improve the lives of individuals that face various autism spectrum disorders. I really hope that you will consider me for this giveaway and thank you for inspiring me daily :)  -Jeannie

Name: Ashley Eng Age: 20 years old  Location: Houston, Texas Instagram handle: ashley_engg If I had the privileged to win $20,000, I would give it all to my momma. Everything she has done for me, all her sacrifices, this amount of money would never be nearly enough to repay her. All of my life, my mommy has sacrificed her happiness and her education to raise my siblings and I and put us through school. For 19-20 years, the majority of my life, my family has lived in a hoarder house... and it is no exaggeration. Behind closed doors, years of arguing and emotional scarring has taken a heavy tool on my mom, my siblings, and I. On the outside, I may seem like a normal student with a normal life, but behind closed doors, you will never see the real life that someone lives. Each year I ask my mom to let us leave.. to finally allow her to be happy and to live the life she has always dreamed of, but every year she tells me "we will the next year when I earn enough money". But every year we stay, because there are endless bills of thousand dollars of debt and bills to pay and expenses. She chooses to stay in a house with someone that has caused her years of torment, for her family and in order to help her kids and her parents and her other family members. My mom has always be this kindhearted angel that took care of her uncle and her parents and every single person in the family, no matter if she had the money or not, and no matter if her own life situation was hard. She never let anyone know, but I have seen her breakdown and cry in my arms about being so sad and unhappy and tired of everything.. My siblings and I work hard everyday to try to alleviate the weight on my mom's shoulders. My momma has told me that after I graduate, that is when she will try to leave, because she won't have enough money to support me on my own now... Even now, my mom struggles to get me through school and has to ask my siblings for favors. Every chance I get, I try to take part-time jobs or random jobs to try to not be a burden on my mom, but it's hard to know that she is staying in this situation for a couple more years, because of me.. First it was going to be "when I graduated high school", then it's "when I graduate college", but every moment that my mom suffers in silence, makes me feel like a burden. I know that this money isn't that much, in perspective of helping clear my mom's debt and her responsibilities, but it would be such a blessing if I could give her this to help her even a little to try and start anew. I don't even need this money for myself, because I do not mind working hard for my own earnings and trying to give my earnings to my mom. I choose a career that is driven by passion and love (and not money), and my mom has always been supportive of that.. but sometimes I think I am being selfish and I want to quit in order to take care of my mom like she has taken care of me. But my mom encourages me to follow my dreams, despite what she has to sacrifice and her sufferings.. and I just wish I could be more than just a burden.  But even if I wasn't chosen, that is okay too. I will continue to work hard and make my momma proud. Thank you for taking the time to read this. And I hope you and everyone are staying safe and healthy. Thank you James for being an inspiration to many and it is always a pleasure to watch your videos. <3

Name: Melanie Anderson Location: Massachusetts Age: 23 Instagram: @melanieandersonn Why: I would use the $20,000 to start an adult services program for individuals with autism and intellectual disabilities. My brother is 22 and has autism. He is unable to speak and relies on my family for everything. Once he turned 22, he aged out of the public school system and my family was challenged with finding an adequate day program for him to attend. After touring many programs, we quickly realized that they all kind of suck. Due to a lack of funding, the individuals receive significantly fewer services than they did in school and lack access to meaningful experiences. Between my background as a special education teacher and a caregiver to someone with such profound needs, I have made it my goal to open my own day program for people like my brother. It will require a TON of fundraising and a lot of hard work, but I am determined to improve this failing system. If you would like to hear more about my goals for the program and my family's story, please reach out!! Thank you, James!!!

Meagan Connolly  20 California, United States (the state my parents are in)  Instagram: palmerremy18  For most of my life I recognized the aspects of my physical appearance that made me look different from my peers, however; somehow I never really thought that there was anything wrong - on a deeper level, I mean. It wasnâ€™t until last year when I visited a neurologist on a fluke recommendation from a cardiologist that I got some form of clarity on what made me look so... unique. I was diagnosed with an LMNA mutation that causes muscular dystrophy and lipodystrophy, two genetic conditions with serious long term health implications. For the first time ever I hated my body - I hated that I looked different - and it almost destroyed me. Even though I had begun taking care of myself physically - exercising, eating well, strength training - I was emotionally drained. It took months to pick myself back up; I even ended up dropping my full time job and just... escaping. I stayed in California for six weeks with my family, which helped a lot and eventually, with their support, I got myself back - I felt like me again, but this time... stronger. Once I was ready I started planning out what my future would have to look like; with two progressive conditions you have to prepare so that you can just... manage. The first thing I did was look into fertility. I knew that I would have trouble conceiving and after speaking to others with my conditions I learned just how much of a toll pregnancy would take on my body. But I thought, â€œIâ€™m young and Iâ€™m being proactive so I have time to figure this outâ€. So I went to a fertility clinic and began that journey (you know the wonderful adventure of attempting to freeze your eggs at 20 years old while essentially single and financially limited). Now this is where the story gets a little upsetting: after some (extremely emotional) testing we discovered that I have a very, very low ovarian reserve. This means that Iâ€™ll likely experience infertility at a young age, which Iâ€™ll admit really sucks because I think Iâ€™d be a really great mum. Anyways, the treatments are extremely expensive and because Iâ€™m on a bit of a time crunch I donâ€™t know if Iâ€™ll be able to afford them until Iâ€™m working, which could mean that I may only really be able to pay for them once Iâ€™m already infertile. I know this is quite the sob story, but I just... I am so used to having to fight for myself. I have fought and fought and fought and frankly this is one battle that I find more exhausting than any other. I know that being able to have children isnâ€™t what makes a woman - I know that - but truly nothing else has ever broken me so hard as the realization that I may never be able to overcome this hurdle. I work really hard for my health and I promise that every time Iâ€™ve fallen, Iâ€™ve dug my way back up kicking and screaming... itâ€™s just this time - just this one time - I want someone there to extend a hand and help me get back to my feet again. Video Content Suggestion: THE MAKING OF EVERY JAMES CHARLES' YOUTUBE VIDEO (An Exclusive Behind-the-Scenes)  It is going to feature the long process of producing phenomenal and viral James Charles' Youtube videos. From the brainstorming stage, the planning, preparation, set-up, long hours of filming, the retakes (which are so fun), bloopers, the editing stage, finalization, the people behind the cameras, and more.  Significance: 1. GENERAL AUDIENCE  It is to show everyone that being a Youtuber and a social media influencer is not easy money and it is not always glitz and glamour. Instead, being a Youtuber is a REAL JOB. And just like any job, the video will show everyone the struggles, the effort, and the stress of being one.  This awareness about a Youtuber life aims to make people understand what the job really is and so that more people can APPRECIATE this career.  Meaning to say, AWARENESS and APPRECIATION.  2. ASPIRING AND SMALL YOUTUBERS The video will show aspiring or small Youtubers out there that this career can be challenging at times but at the end of the day, it is a lot of FUN and it is REWARDING. This will INSPIRE small Youtubers to continue filming Youtube videos and keep pursuing this passion of being an influencer.  Meaning to say, INSPIRATION.  3. SISTERS  The video will provide SISTERS around the globe a closer look of our dear JAMES CHARLES life as a Youtuber and eventually bring the SISTERHOOD closer to each other.  This video is going to be a BLAST because many people are interested what really happens behind the scenes of trending Youtube videos. "Piccolina, don't give me that look." Leo's accent became thicker, more rugged as he spoke. He pressed Carmin against the door, quickly reaching down to lock the knob.  "Why are you here?"  "You know why I'm here."   "I don't." Carmin squirmed a bit under his hold. The feel of him was growing more natural, more normal.  "You've been avoiding me." Leo moved his hand from the lock, to her chin, ensuring she had her eyes on him.  Carmin squinched her eyebrows showing that cute confused expression Leo loved so much. "Can...Can we just forget about the kiss, It's driving me crazy."  Her forwardness was something Leo would never get tired of.  "Piccolina, I like you."  "What?"  "I like you  and you have to deal with it. No more hiding out. No more running away."  "I-"  "I kissed you for a reason and I'm not gonna pretend it didn't happen." Leo's eyes grew a bit darker. hi James! I love you and your house but as an interior design major, I cringe when people use the word design when they mean decor. The company that decorated your gorgeous home are decorators, not designers. Designers create floorpans, lighting plans (which is an art and science in itself, form elevations, sections and much more. Please use your platform to inform, not misinform. again, absolutely no hate, I just love to spread the word because its a popular stereotype :)
